channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-10563] MiniTezCliDriver tests ordering issues
item.description: There are a bunch of tests related to TestMiniTezCliDriver which gives ordering issues when run on Centos/Windows/OSX

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I'm +1 on this patch, since what it's doing is essentially making sure that ordering issues do not cause a problem. Ultimately, we should take on a task to make sure that our test cases do not care about order if marked with some set variable, and use that(like we sometimes do for os version or hadoop version), since introducing blanket order-by actually changes the clause we might be testing elsewhere. Tagging ashutoshc to bring this notion to his attention.

For this patch, though, we should limit the scope of this, and get it in.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12730256 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Actually, I should have seen this on my review earlier - changes to .q files would result in changes to .out files, if only from the query being different. Also, given that it introduces a sort ordering, any explain will be different in the .out. Could you please regen your patch including all the .out changes?

sushanth you are thinking in right direction, only that it already exists : )
Comment directive -- SORT_QUERY_RESULTS is invented for this exact used case. Please use that instead of adding order by in queries. If anything else (ie other than query result set) is order sensitive, then use --SORT_BEFORE_DIFF

Awesome! That is good news.

hsubramaniyan, could you use that instead?
Note that the sort directive will not work for queries that involve limit. There is at least one such query in this case. But for other queries, the sort directive would be better.

hsubramaniyan I took a quick look at QTestUtil, it looks like the directive is only per .q file. It does not seem to be required per query. ashutoshc Is my understanding right ?

In the new patch this query with order-by added does not seem to really need it -
For example -

auto_join0.q
-  (SELECT * FROM src WHERE src.key < 10) src1 
+  (SELECT * FROM src WHERE src.key < 10 order by src.key, src.value) src1 
     JOIN 
-  (SELECT * FROM src WHERE src.key < 10) src2
+  (SELECT * FROM src WHERE src.key < 10 order by src.key, src.value) src2
I have not verified in code, but thats my understanding too. Only once in q file should be sufficient to cover for all queries in it.

Hi Hari,

Apologies for the late reply - having looked at all the .q files now, I'm +1 on it. However, I'm afraid I took too long to review this, and this now requires a rebase to update to latest. When applying this patch now, I get the following:

error: patch failed: ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/spark/vectorized_timestamp_funcs.q.out:694
error: ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/spark/vectorized_timestamp_funcs.q.out: patch does not apply
error: patch failed: ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/tez/vectorized_timestamp_funcs.q.out:694

error: patch failed: ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/vectorized_timestamp_funcs.q.out:659
error: ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/vectorized_timestamp_funcs.q.out: patch does not apply

Could you please update the patch? Also, I noticed a couple of trailing spaces in a couple of your edits that git complains about. Once you have your patch up again, and we have the precommit tests run, I'll commit it quickly.

Updating the .q files after rebase.

Thanks
Hari

Committed to master. Thanks, Hari!

Also, this patch does not apply to branch-1.2. So as to keep the two branch tests in sync, I would like to see this there as well. Hari, could you please backport this and upload a patch for branch-1.2 as well?

sushanth Here is the patch , HIVE-10563-branch12.patch for branch-1.2. Fortunately, I just needed to run vectorized_timestamp_funcs.q alone to resolve the conflicts.

Thanks
Hari
